attributes.action: Secretary of Education Should be Dismissed
attributes.background: Sack, with immediate effect, Gavin Williamson.
attributes.additional_details: A total misunderstanding of how the education environment properly works, COVID or not.

rejection.details: We can't accept petitions about honours or appointments, which includes calling for Ministers or MPs to be sacked, resign, or to be subject to a recall vote or a vote of no confidence.

attributes.action: Refund university fees while face to face learning is cancelled.
attributes.background: Refund fees for students who have missed a significant amount of learning from academic years 19/20 and 20/21. There has been little to no support, and a untold amount of pressure and stress on students.
attributes.additional_details: Consider the effects that the lockdowns are causing not only on the learning but the effect this will have on students knowledge and application long term. In addition the mental effect this is having on the students, not having the ability to be in a learning environment with correct resources, but knowing they are being put in debt for a degree they’re not being taught.

attributes.action: Vaccinate teachers and support staff NOW to keep schools OPEN
attributes.background: Prioritise COVID vaccinations for teachers, TA’s and all ancillary support staff to keep schools open.
attributes.additional_details: Child education in the school environment is essential for child mental heath, social interaction and development and academic wellbeing. This is especially true for primary school children who are in the most crucial developmental stages of life. To be able to provide the best quality of education schools need to be a safe place for children and teachers. Teaching staff provide high quality essential work for the future generation and should be prioritised in receiving the COVID vaccine.

attributes.action: Close Schools in Tier 4 Areas
attributes.background: Shut schools in Tier 4 areas. Recognise schools as super-spreaders, and take the necessary precautions to protect children, staff, and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
This is a dangerous time and the government's lack of concern for educational professionals, children and their families is despicable at best.
Many children and their families in tier 4 areas are vulnerable. The statistics show that school environments are super-spreaders. The safety of students, staff, and their families should be the government's highest priority. Keep Britain safe.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/564209

attributes.action: Create a more solid process to assess risk of someone before discharge.
attributes.background: Create a supportive structured plan that actually happens. If people present themselves as suicidal at a place of safety this should not be invalidated and should be placed in a safe environment. More training and funding to recruiting of appropriately accredited staff and more money and awareness.
attributes.additional_details: If someone was in a safe environment or had appropriate support in place , there will be less suicides so lower death rate, individuals will then have access to support and more trust in mental health services as this can be massively lost to the let down of support available. There will be a lower risk of harm and vulnerability to young people and adults , doing this will not only save an individual but also save the hearts of many family members of devastation and distress.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We do currently have these petitions open which you might like to sign:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557313
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334029
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552300

attributes.action: Stop deportation flights to Jamaica
attributes.background:
• CEASE all deportation flights NOW
• Fulfil the promise of a “compassionate” response to the Windrush scandal
• End “double punishments” whereby criminals serve their time but are still torn from their families
• End the hostile environment, and the practice of indefinite detention / deportation
attributes.additional_details:
31 children are expected to be separated from their dads on December the 2nd. 8 of the detainees have been here for 18+ years, and several arrived as kids. 

One detainee has attempted suicide, but was immediately returned to the facility. 

These people mostly have drug-related convictions. According to the Lammy Review, people of colour are 240% more likely to be convicted for drug offences than their white counterparts. 

Since March 2018 at least 5 deportees to Jamaica have died.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/562260

attributes.action: Keep Covid Safe Fitness Classes Open in Tier 3.
attributes.background:
Many fitness industry businesses run solely on class environments with Covid compliant rules in place. We are allowed to open under gyms but the entire business is viable through class instruction.
We need to be able to run socially distanced and covid compliant classes in Tier 3.
attributes.additional_details:
Studios that cater for dance, pole fitness, aerial arts, yoga and Pilates are predominantly attended and owned by women. 
Gyms can be intimidating and many women do not feel safe or comfortable to exercise in these settings.
The decision to ban activities in Tier 3 affects 1000’s of businesses and the inability to keep mentally and physically well.
This is an equality issue. Classes are reduced in numbers, pre booked and monitored carefully, attendance control is safer than random gym visits.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555618

attributes.action: Allow pubs and hospitality to reopen at all tier levels during the tier system
attributes.background: Since pubs and the hospitality trade reopened back in the summer, all facilities were asked to adopt covid rules and regulations to ensure a safe environment is created for individuals which use the pubs.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should allow the pub and hospitality sector to reopen at all tier levels and operate within a safe and covid secure environment. How’s it safe for 10,000 people to attend a shopping centre all indoors but 30 people aren’t able to sit in a covid secure area within a pub. Both sectors at a combined total is valued at £95bn, Britain is close to losing its tradition with the pub, the government must act now and allow the industry to reopen in a safe environment to safe jobs

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/561716

attributes.action: Test School Staff regularly for Covid-19
attributes.background: Provide regular free testing for school staff both primary and secondary including additional staff such as cleaners, lunchtime supervisors and office staff to ensure school environments are safe for children and staff, to help them stay open and to help schools prevent the spread of Covid-19.
attributes.additional_details: Provide regular (at least fortnightly) testing for school staff to ensure that school environments are as safe as possible for both staff and pupils as it has recently come to light that some adults do not have any symptoms and therefore may be unknowingly spreading covid within the school setting. Providing regular testing for school staff may help schools stay open and take action quicker in the event that a staff member tests positive and to reduce the spread of Covid within them.

attributes.action: Open Covid-19 safe hair salons  barbers and beauty salons
attributes.background: The government are closing salons which are provably the most safe clean covid safe environments when other not so hygienic businesses are able to open
attributes.additional_details: As an industry we have spent time doing risk assessments planned ways of making sure staff and clients are safe, spent money investing and implementing safe procedures, clean and sanitise constantly and maintain safe work practices and ways of working. Let hair salons, barbers and beauty salons that meet these safe work processes open

attributes.action: Cancel all A-level and GCSE exams in 2021
attributes.background:
Cancel the exams A-level, AS, GCSE because
- 6 month gap out of learning environment (although work set, not all students caught up for many reasons)
- Students with 3 hour lessons struggling with retention
- Mental health caused by ordeal
- Online lessons, not engaging
attributes.additional_details: Students that are affected are struggling for a multitude of reasons. The main reason being the 6 month gap out of education that we had which although students were assigned work to do, many were demotivated or mentally affected by this whole ordeal. As a result, students have been left with a substantial amount of  work to catch up on. Causing a lot of anxiety and distress which is leading them to struggle to maintain good grades and therefore, effective exam preparation is lacking.

attributes.action: Silent only fireworks on sale in the UK
attributes.background: Limit the sale of fireworks that emit noise to those holding organised displays, allow noise free fireworks ONLY to be sold to the general public
attributes.additional_details: Many people and animals suffer discomfort and sometimes terror during the weeks leading up to and the weeks beyond bonfire night. Each and every year they seem to get louder and the period of time they are used extends, by removing the sound, you are creating a better environment for all, human, domestic pets, agricultural animals and wildlife.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549758

While some fireworks are marketed as silent, these still make some noise. If you would like the Government to reduce the decibel limit to a specific level, you could start a new petition requesting this.

We have also published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Limit the Sale and Use of Fireworks to Organisers of Licensed Displays Only: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

Ban the use of all fireworks in order to reduce air and noise pollution: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334448

attributes.action: End Deer Culls in Royal Parks
attributes.background: Make it illegal to cull deer by shooting in Royal Parks
attributes.additional_details: Shooting deer on Royal Parks grounds causes suffering not only to the deer, but to the wildlife populations in the surrounding environment. Royal Parks should not be using their grounds to raise deer and then sell them for meat. They should adopt humane methods of managing deer populations- or phase them out completely.

rejection.details:
Royal Parks is now independent of the UK government, so decisions about operational matters such as the culling of deer is a matter for the Royal Parks, not the Government or House of Commons.

You could contact the Royal Parks directly to raise your concerns about the deer culls: https://www.royalparks.org.uk/about-us/contact-us

attributes.action: Limit firework use for the sake of animals and air pollution
attributes.background: I think there should be a law whereby there is a day and time limit that private households can let off fireworks in urban areas for celebrations such as Bonfire night or New Year's Eve or even limit fireworks to public displays only.
attributes.additional_details: Our pets and other animals go through extreme stress for days during these celebrations especially as they are unaware when they will happen and how many days for and we as owners do not know when to give them calming therapies.  Also,  fireworks have an impact on air pollution and so would help the environment for the future.

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Review the closure of certain businesses in the second lockdown
attributes.background: A recent sage report has confirmed that hair salons are not involved in the rise of covid 19, with a risk of 0.05% . How many businesses are closed that are actually covid safe? The reasoning behind closures needs to be based upon facts not assumptions. Open all businesses that are Covid safe.
attributes.additional_details: This time of year is essential for all retailers and personal care industry. By closing them without the facts to back it up, when the science is stating that salons in particular are safe environments, at the same time keeping schools and universities open when the rates are constantly increasing, is disproportionate and highly unlawful. Each industry should be rated upon risk of transmission and closed according to risk. Not this knee jerk reaction that has been taken. Look at the facts.

Allow us to work

It’s for mental health is so important

attributes.additional_details: Students are not only receiving a compromised university education, but also a compromised learning environment within hospitals which are already dealing with extreme stress. attributes.background: Enforce health workers to get changed into their clinical clothes at work and change again before leaving.
attributes.additional_details: This is a vital precaution to prevent germs from being carried into a clinical environment on clothing and lessen the risk of transferring pathogens to the outside world especially during this Covid 19 pandemic.

attributes.action: Reduce Coursework units for vocational Qualifications due to lost time.
attributes.background:
Due to Corona virus teachers and students have been put under huge amounts of pressure and lack of face to face time.

With vocational courses still expected to produce the same output of work with restrictions on whether you can do coursework at home (OCR level 2 iMedia do not allow this)
attributes.additional_details:
Reduce unit expectations inline with the consolation that was first put forward by OCR. This meant less Coursework units to be completed, use of teacher assessed grades.

 As it stands teachers in an already changed and stressful working environment are going to struggle with there mental health. Students who take vocational courses are being unfairly punished due to COVID compared to more academic courses.

This needs to be fixed and teachers need to be show support by the government during these challenging times.

rejection.details:
The content of vocational courses is a matter for individual course providers and examination boards, not the Government or House of Commons.

If you are concerned about the impact of the current outbreak on your studies you should contact your course provider to discuss this.

attributes.action: Change lockdown rules to prevent driving tests being cancelled
attributes.background: This second lockdown is causing many people who are key workers who are needed to drive in order to support families to wait another 4 weeks to book another driving test. I believe this should not be the case as schools are still remained open which cause more virus to spread
attributes.additional_details: I wish to allow participants to take their driving tests, these tests will be able to get more people from using public transport as well as the test itself being 1-1 with a clean environment where both members would wear gloves and masks to prevent the spread of this virus. The organisation of this has left many in confusion as they have had no contact from the dvla to say their test will be cancelled, this will also lose the dvla money also

attributes.action: Keep children in school.
attributes.background: Keep schools open during the lockdown.
attributes.additional_details: Lockdown has had a big effect on children all over the UK. Parents are still expected to work, how can that be made possible when we have children at home to look after?. My son is very behind for his age because of the lockdown, and I have seen so much progress since starting back in September. I cannot teach my children at home, what a teacher can teach them in a school environment. There are people working essential jobs all over the country. Teaching is an essential job.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/558050

attributes.background: The government need to keep gyms open regardless of a lockdown. Gyms are to be considered just as essential as supermarkets for food.
attributes.additional_details:
The virus has affected many individuals and thankfully a lot of our people have survived it. This is due to having a clean bill of health which is procured in a gym environment. 

Gyms have proactively spaced out equipment to keep distance. The cleaning regimen, even by members, is so through, I could eat my dinner off the gym floor. 

Just as much as we need schools to stay open for the future of our children, we need gyms to stay open for the future of our healths’.

attributes.action: Keep all shops open during the second lockdown
attributes.background:
Keep ALL retail shops open during the second lockdown regardless of whether they are classed as “Essential” or not. What is not deemed essential to one person maybe essential to another. 
We must live with this virus and support Our high street otherwise the internet giants become the only option.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the end of the first lockdown the retail sector has proved they can provide a safe environment for customers. By restricting numbers, providing hand sanitiser, ensuring social distancing & the requirement for face coverings they have done exactly what has been required to stop the spread of COVID-19 within shops.

November & December are the busiest & most crucial time for retailers. As a country we need to live with the virus, not hide from it. Support OUR high street before it disappears

attributes.action: Be allowed to see relatives in care homes, even for a short amount of time.
attributes.background: To be allowed to see my mum during covid 19. For people to be allowed to see relatives in a care home once a week, even for 15 minutes like at the start of the lockdown. This seems to have been forgotten about and now I haven’t seen my mum since august.
attributes.additional_details:
Because I haven’t hugged my mum since March, I have seen her 4 times for 15 minutes each time since March and haven’t seen her at all since august. I feel like care homes have been forgotten about during covid and there are more talks about gyms. I need my mum and my mum needs me.
Please can we arrange a safe environment to see each other even for 15 minutes again.
Please

rejection.details:

This guidance notes that visiting should be supported and enabled wherever it is possible to do so safely, including indoor visits in all local tiers where the visitor has been tested and returned a negative result. See
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/visiting-care-homes-during-coronavirus/update-on-policies-for-visiting-arrangements-in-care-homes

If there are changes you would like to see to this guidance, you could start a new petition calling for those changes.

We understand that it is important for children to get an education but if it means putting their parents/carers at risk it could lead to greater issues.

attributes.background:

Keep youth football alive and running as normal.

Coaches put so much time into being covid secure and maintaining distancing and a safe environment to train and play.

attributes.background:

Keeping them open not only helps mental health, but thousands of business owners whose business may not survive a second lockdown.
attributes.additional_details:
Gyms have not once been used as a statistic for higher levels of COVID-19 cases. They offer a safe and clean environment where people can successfully social distance whilst improving their physical and mental health. 
In turn keeping them open helps business who would otherwise furlough. Gyms have a two-fold effect on helping individuals’ wellbeing as well as aiding the economy in this sector.

attributes.action: Allow beauty businesses in Nottinghamshire to remain open
attributes.background: The Government need to review the new Tier 3 Plus COVID restrictions for Nottinghamshire, to allow beauty and tattoo salons to remain open. Nottinghamshire are the only district to have decided they should close for 28 days.
attributes.additional_details:
Beauty salons and Tattoo Parlours are some of the most sterile and cleanliest environments you could visit, even before a virus outbreak. Using gloves, aprons and face masks, the risk is substantially smaller than that of some other businesses.
If each individual business is willing to put the necessary COVID precautions in place, and to be inspected, these businesses should be allowed to remain open. 
28 days may not seem a lot to some, but for a small business owner, it is a lifetime.

attributes.action: Reduce the content of A Level examinations
attributes.background: The Government should reduce the content of A Level examinations in 2021 due to the disruption of Covid-19. Approximately 6 months of adequate teaching has been lost, and pushing the exams back by a couple of weeks is not enough. This has already had a huge impact on the studying of so many.
attributes.additional_details: Students in the UK have already missed hundreds of hours of learning since March. Some pupils don’t have the essential resources: a working computer, textbooks, stationary, etc. Many don’t have a proper learning environment, therefore results will most certainly not reflect the true potential of pupils. Hence why I am writing to the Government to reduce the content of A Level examinations to allow students across the country to be much better equipped and less disadvantaged.

attributes.action: Re-open indoor socially distanced gym classes.
attributes.background:
Following Tier 3 announcements today in the South Yorkshire region, it has been explained that gyms may be open, but supervised socially distanced classes are to be closed.
This is baffling.
We request that gyms, yoga studios, village halls are allowed to run socially distanced classes.
attributes.additional_details:
Fitness is crucial to mental and physical health.  Most people who attend group exercise classes are not comfortable or confident in a pure gym environment.    I use the example of the over 65's who visit a yoga studio who now will simply not exercise. 
Coaches, Trainers, instructors are present in class to ensure safety of movement, social distancing and to improve social distancing.  When you remove a coach/instructor - you remove the safety element.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555618

attributes.action: Group fitness to resume using Covid secure measures as before.
attributes.background:
Group fitness exercises classes are a vital part not only to promote health and fitness to the body but also to the mind.
Thousands of people use fitness classes not only as a way of becoming fitter but as an escape.
An escape from home, work etc it’s a way to release their stresses.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people need motivation and support that a fitness instructor gives during these group exercise classes. Gyms and studios have all the Covid secure measures in place, no mixing, social distancing, track and trace, regular cleaning etc
The levels of infection in a class fitness environment is so very very low it’s practically  unheard of. We are capable of keeping everyone Covid secure as per the guidelines we need to  continue on for the people for their physical and mental healths.

attributes.action: All MPs to take a pay cut to 66% of their salary
attributes.background:
All MPs to take a pay cut to 66% of their salary
All UK MPs to take a pay cut to 66% of their salary in line with the majority of the country.
attributes.additional_details: MP's may talk about being 'in it together' but they sit in a secure and subsidised environment. This pay cut and the money raised can contribute towards the Corona Pandemic by helping those affected.

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for setting MPs' pay. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out more about IPSA here: https://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/

attributes.action: Free the North – hold a referendum for a devolved 'North of England Parliament'
attributes.background:
Government should support fair and democratic representation by holding a referendum in the North of England for full devolution.

A ‘North of England Parliament’ is the only way to truly represent the best interests of the people of the North of England.
attributes.additional_details:
I call on the Government to hold a referendum for full devolution to the North of England. This would take place on the same day, in all of the constituencies of the following official regions of England:
- North East England
- North West England
- Yorkshire and the Humber

Following a successful referendum, a ‘North of England Parliament’ would have powers over the following areas:
- Health
- Education
- Economic Development
- Transport
- The Environment
- Agriculture
- Local Government
- Taxes

attributes.action: Introduce biodegradable cigarette filter tips for sale in all uk supermarkets
attributes.background: Plastic filter tips are one of the largest contributors to litter and pollution on land and in the oceans. They take decades to break down, therefore once in the environment they cause issues for many years. This is why the government must ensure the provision of more eco-friendly alternatives.
attributes.additional_details: Cigarette filter tips are ubiquitous both in urban and coastal environments, they are the most common form of litter found during beach clean ups, with about 4 TRILLION being discarded into the environment globally each year. Once in the environment these filters cause harm such as degrading habitats through the leaching of harmful toxins or the deaths of organisms through ingestion. therefore it is important there is greater accessibility to biodegradable alternatives.

rejection.details:
Deciding whether to stock biodegradable filter tips is a matter for individual retailers, not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban plastic cigarette filters: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330424

Require products containing plastic to be clearly labelled: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550136

attributes.action: Allow close contact services to resume in Scotland.
attributes.background:
We would like close contact services to resume in Scotland, and allow the removal of masks to perform treatments in a safe and hygienic manner, to include makeup, facials etc 
Every other country has resumed treatments however Scotland have not even addressed this.
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland are the only country not addressing the close contact industry. you are able to remove masks for long periods of time to eat in restaurants, drink in bars with strangers, men can get a beard trim, you can visit the dentist, visit hairdressers, yet we can’t perform makeup, facials etc in a sterile and safe environment, with full PPE and following guidelines.
This is currently causing a collapse in the industry, leading to closures of businesses and mental health.
Please address this

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it.

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here:

http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx

attributes.action: Allow fans into football grounds to aide the survival of some football clubs.
attributes.background: For the Premiere League and EFL clubs in particular, where match day revenue is crucial, the answer will be potentially devastating if fans at a reduced capacity are not allowed back in, in a safe and controlled environment.
attributes.additional_details: From Elite football teams to Non League when hosting Elite teams, the decision not allow fans into grounds must be reviewed. If it is not done so this decision could cost thousands of jobs and result in a clubs going out of business. How can it be deemed safe to visit cinemas and other indoor venues when allowing fans in a reduced capacity and in a controlled manner in an outside setting is deemed not to be safe. The benefits of allowing fans back into grounds also promotes positive well-being.

attributes.action: Cancel the Curfew
attributes.background: Remove the 10pm curfew imposed on hospitality by the Government and allow businesses to continue trading as they have been - in accordance with the guidance, safely and securely.
attributes.additional_details:
The latest statistics suggest that infections in hospitality establishments are among the lowest in any area - This curfew unfairly punishes the industry as well as pushing customers into unregulated, unsafe environments.

A large number of establishments (particularly "wet-led") rely on trade post-10pm. Forcing businesses to close this early reduces trading time substantially and will lead to closures, mass job losses and a huge reduction in tax revenue for the public purse.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551634

attributes.action: Reverse the retrograde 10pm curfew on the hospitality sector
attributes.background: Reverse the introduction of the 10pm curfew which is penalising an already hard-hit industry. It is a measure that does nothing to stop the spread of coronavirus and indeed may make matters worse.
attributes.additional_details:
On the 22nd of September, The Licensees Association wrote to The Secretary of State outlining why we believe the introduction of a 10pm curfew on the hospitality sector was a retrograde step and also that it simply wouldn't work.

The curfew doesn't apply to the off-trade and we have seen people simply leaving supervised environments to unsupervised ones increasing risk. The curfew makes maters worse and penalises the hospitality sector.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551634

attributes.action: Extend the exemptions of meetings of groups of 6 to amateur music making groups
attributes.background: Organised sports can meet in covid safe ways; amateur music making groups should be allowed to meet also.  Arguably there is less risk involved as chairs can be arranged in socially distanced ways and in a covid secure environment.  To promote wellbeing and mental wellness these groups should run.
attributes.additional_details: The rules for exemption should be fair.  Strangers can meet in less socially distanced ways in pubs and cafes.  Organised music making can provide covid secure environments and should be on equal footing with organised sport exemptions.

attributes.action: Maintain our food standards post-Brexit
attributes.background: Maintain food standards to protect the public’s health animals and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: The Government has repeatedly promised it will not compromise on our food standards in new trade deals that it agrees, such that produce including chlorinated chicken and hormone-fed beef would still be restricted. A statutory instrument agreed last year revokes legal reference to the list of restricted/banned medicines for use on farm animals-why? A trade deal that compromises our food standards and/or the environment, even with higher tariffs for sub-standard produce, should not be agreed.
